title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Tuesday 21 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: labour leader corbyn attends candy atherton 's funeral .
motorcyclist seriously injured in three-vehicle crash .
man found guilty of smothering dementia patient wife .
no confidence motion in police commissioner is defeated .
sw sex workers 'fail to report abuse ' .
man assaulted and taken to cash machine by robbers .
plymouth olympian tonia couch retires from diving .
milking it ? priest makes dog collar from dairy bottle .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: tuna feeding off cornwall 'like blue planet show '
text: a cornish kayaker has described witnessing a feeding frenzy by giant bluefin tuna in the sea off fowey as like watching a scene from television programme blue planet ii .
rupert kirkwood managed to catch some amazing of the fish , which is one of the largest species of tuna in the world .
it was seen when he and others were paddling at sea just two miles off fowey recently .
they identified what the creature was after `` large splashes '' nearby after initially thinking it was a dolphin .
he added that its presence off cornwall could mean another predator in local waters .
he said : `` funnily enough , tuna are top of the orca 's [ killer whale 's ] meal list , so you never know . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: labour leader corbyn speaks at candy atherton 's funeral
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn was among the speakers at the funeral of former labour mp and cornwall councillor candy atherton .
as well as speaking , he laid a wreath in tribute which thanked her for her `` service and dedication to the labour party '' .
it added : `` the labour family is better and stronger because of you and we will miss you . ''
ms atherton died suddenly on 30 october , aged 62 .
she won the marginal seat of falmouth and camborne in 1997 for labour , holding it for eight years , before losing it in 2005 to the liberal democrats .
she was elected to cornwall council in 2013 .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: cornwall considers free life jackets for fishing crews
text: a scheme to hand out life jackets to fishing crews in plymouth could be replicated in cornwall .
two-hundred-and-fifty of the potentially life-saving devices with built-in locator beacons are being issued in the devon city .
the first plymouth crews have just received the life jackets after the city council secured £ 77,000 from the european maritime and fisheries fund and the maritime management organisation .
it follows a number of campaigns to get fishermen to wear life jackets , and the rnli is on board with this latest move to directly equip boats .

cornwall councillors are discussing whether they could make a similar application for funding to help ensure local fisherman who would struggle financially to buy a potentially lifesaving piece of equipment could have it provided by the council at no cost .
author: Hannah Stacey
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather : dry overnight , and dry and windy on wednesday
text: most places will stay dry , but also rather cloudy overnight .
however , one or two outbreaks of drizzle will remain possible across the moors .
it will also be rather breezy and mild .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
wednesday will see a dry , but generally cloudy start , with winds strengthening through the morning .
outbreaks of rain will then spread in from the west , and are likely to turn heavy at times during the afternoon .
despite this , it will be an exceptionally mild day , especially in the drier spells .
maximum temperature : 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plymouth warships ' removal reports 'speculation '
text: the government says no decisions have been made amidst concerns there might be plans to take two south west-based specialist landing ships out of service .

a special debate has been held in parliament as mps from devon and cornwall insisted that threats to the uk 's amphibious capability - the ability to operate on land and water - mean the royal navy could lose its ability to attack enemy-held beaches .
two plymouth-based specialist landing ships , hms albion ( and hms bulwark , have been reported as facing being taken out of service under such proposals .
defence minister harriet baldwin described discussions so far as `` pure speculation '' .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: breakingpolice commissioner no confidence motion defeated
text: a motion of no confidence in devon and cornwall police and crime commissioner alison hernandez has been defeated by cornwall council at a full meeting of the authority .
the motion was tabled by labour 's tim dwelly with some other labour and liberal democrat support .

it was `` intended to encourage her to consider her position '' , highlighted concerns over cuts to the number of pcsos , and said her actions had `` brought the role [ of commissioner ] into disrepute ( such as calling for residents with guns to be prepared to fight terrorists ) '' .
before the vote , conservative ms hernandez said it was `` political mischief making '' , and that she had made £ 24m available to increase police officer numbers .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: rare life-saving medal on display in dartmouth
text: an extremely rare medal , which was last awarded almost 50 years ago , is going on display in dartmouth .
the albert medal was originally awarded for saving lives .
the one going on display at the britannia royal naval college museum was awarded to lieutenant david wainwright .
he rescued two crew members from a flooded hold when their minesweeper hit a mine after world war one .
the award has since been succeeded by the george cross , which now makes the albert medal extremely rare and worth thousand of pounds .
author: John Ayres
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: more mysterious road markings , this time in mousehole
text: the lines in mousehole come after tiny markings were painted on a section of road in hayle , baffling residents .
the lines were painted after a section of the hayle road was removed and then re-laid by a utilities company as part of gas service work .

after the tiny double yellow lines at # hayle michael sends us this photo of mysterious road markings at chapel street , # mousehole @ cornwallcouncil tell us the new white lines were painted by contractors , a @ twitterid team will soon finish the job
these must have been made by a kangaroo on skis !
some fine @ twitterid works enjoying the days weather !
how clean there they uniforms are !
nearly finished our road/groundwork 's in # stives after nearly two years !
would love to know at what cost to the rate payers !
( 1/3 ) hey simon , our new apprentice in the image joined us last week and his hi viz kit is brand new .
the photo shows him acting as a banksman to ensure the residents and traffic can pass by the heavy plant safely .
( 2/3 ) tregwarry rd turned out to be a more complex scheme than thought when the 18 '' hole opened up in the pavement .
the 15m deep mineshaft that was eventually capped , covers a large area of the road and embankment , & the works also required the underpinning of one of the houses .
( 3/3 ) these unmapped mine workings cover a vast area beneath the road , and have had to have extensive stabilisation work to ensure the safety of road users and residents .
hope this helps : )
thought you need a ticket to be a banksman ! ?
i have too !
fully aware of this on going problem with the works , just fed up with the dust and dirty all over my house and cars ! !
still have n't said how much it 's costing !
bet the # idiot contract negotiators allowed a clause that said `` only paint it on the bit of road you have repaired '' .
did you say 'a cormac team will soon finish the job ' ?
there 's confidence .
well placed i 'm sure .

documents.title: south west water 'uses dowsing rods to find mains '
text: dowsing - the art of trying to find sources of water and other materials below the ground using nothing but a twig or rods as an apparatus - is something that has been attempted for centuries .
divining rods and dowsing tools are associated by many with ancient skills and witchcraft , but some companies still use the technique .
hi @ twitterid @ twitterid do your technicians ever use ( among other techniques ) divination or dowsing rods to locate water pipes or leaks underground ?
hi @ twitterid yes on occasions we use divining or dowsing rods to locate water mains however they are not accurate 100 % of the time .
as a customer , i 'd rather you did n't spend my money on unscientific piffle .
it 's the 21st century , and you should n't be relying on random guesswork dressed up as magic .
`` they are not accurate 100 % of the time '' .
no kidding .
hey , i 've got some leak-detecting beans for sale if you want them ?
@ swwhelp just to clarify : by not accurate 100 % of the time , '' do you mean they 're inaccurate 100 % of the time , or they are not always accurate ?
asking because it matters .
is that the official company line ?
@ twitterid says otherwise , see

documents.title: breakingman , 89 , smothered dementia patient wife
text: an 89-year-old former policeman has been found guilty of killing his wife , who had dementia .
douglas addison was married to his 88-year-old wife , mary , for decades and nursed her at their bungalow in st merryn , cornwall , where he killed her , exeter crown court was told .
he turned down attempts by his gp and social workers to help him look after her before she was hit around the head with a blunt object , possibly a walking stick , and smothered in february .
addison now has severe dementia himself and was unable to attend the trial .
he was ruled unfit to enter a plea because of his medical condition , so the jury was asked to just determine the facts of the case .
a high court judge presiding over the case has detained addison in a mental hospital .
author: Janine Jansen
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: tonia couch retirement : coach 's leaving 'a factor '
text: olympic diver tonia couch has admitted the departure of her long-term coach was a reason - but not the only factor - behind her decision to step away from competition .
the plymouth-based three-time diver has announced her retirement from diving and is taking up a coaching role in the city .
the 28-year-old is one of britain 's most decorated female divers having won silver in glasgow 2014 commonwealth and three european medals during a 12-year senior career .
long-term plymouth diving head coach and mentor andy banks ( with couch ) , who also trained tom daley , left in may and is coaching the australian national team .

she said banks ' move was `` tough '' for her to accept , but added : `` i have n't enjoyed training as much as i thought i would after the [ 2016 ] olym and it was hard to motivate myself when i 'm 10 years or more older than everyone else .
`` british diving is in such a great place now though and i 'm looking forward to helping develop some of the young talent by teaching them about my experiences at the top .
`` it 's so special to have that chance here in plymouth . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: kalashnikov and replica tommy gun handed in to police
text: a kalashnikov assault rifle , a selection of `` wild west style six-shooter '' revolvers and a `` very realistic replica '' of a thompson sub-machine gun - or tommy gun - are among weapons and ammunition handed in to police in cornwall during a two-week national firearms amnesty , police say .
officers said the kalashnikov and the revolvers came in from camborne , while the tommy gun replica came from the st austell area .
talking about the tommy gun , police said : `` replica or not , it is not something that anyone would want to look down the barrel of . ''
the amnesty runs until the end of the week .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: college hits back after claim children are bullied
text: brixham college today pledged a `` zero tolerance '' approach after a weekend facebook furore over claims of bullying .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: seaside towns 'still old-fashioned and closed in winter '
text: a report into britain 's seaside towns says there are still perceptions of them as old-fashioned , closed in the winter and difficult to get to .
the conclusions come from the all-party parliamentary group for the visitor economy , chaired by st austell and newquay conservative mp , steve double .
the group has been looking at how the seaside economy could continue to thrive if and when european funding is withdrawn once the uk has left the eu .

they 've come up with a list or recommendations which include reducing vat on tourist accommodation and attractions to 5 % , introducing more frequent bus services , and reducing the aggressive behaviour of seagulls in some resorts which have been putting visitors off .
mr double said the british coastline was a national asset with great potential and which , with the right investment , could drive regeneration , economic growth and job creation .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police investigations 'not hit by forensics manipulation '
text: devon and cornwall police say no cases related to the force have been affected by an investigation into alleged data manipulation at a forensics laboratory used by police across the country .
two people have been arrested in connection with the inquiry into randox testing services in manchester .
the problem has already led to about 50 prosecutions nationwide being ended .
more than 10,000 cases involving drugs - including violent and sexual crimes - may have been affected , according to the national police chiefs ' council .
the irregularities involve test results between 2013 and this year .
re-tests will have been carried out on 1,500 cases by the end of the year .

devon and cornwall police said : `` the police operation to retest manipulated forensic tests from randox testing services has confirmed there are no cases relating to devon , cornwall or the isles of scilly . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paignton meeting to debate nhs 's future in south devon
text: campaigners who fought to save paignton community hospital ( from closure but failed are holding a meeting in the town to discuss the future of the nhs in south devon .

the last few patients were discharged from paignton 's hospital in april , with the local clinical commissioning group saying the move would cut hospital admissions and allow more people to be treated in their own homes .
organisers of the meeting said the gathering was open to anyone who wanted to have a say about healthcare provision in the area .
it starts at 19:00 at winner street baptist church .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: training to help sex workers 'should be supported '
text: a mistrust of the police and support services means sex workers in devon and cornwall are failing to report abusive and violent predators who pose a risk to the wider public , it 's claimed .
a national charity said reports of abuse were a fraction of the actual crimes committed because of a breakdown in trust between victims and the authorities .
now front line services such as the police are being trained to support sex workers better .
sex worker charlotte rose said it was a positive step forward .

she said : `` if they are prepared in trying to create a relationship with sex workers so they do have that trust , so they would be able to go to them in the first instance , then that would be absolutely fantastic and that is something that we should all support . ''
devon and cornwall police said officers were committed to supporting people who had been abused , regardless of their profession , and they urged victims to come forward .

charlotte rose tells @ twitterid @ twitterid some of her fellow sex workers are failing to report abusive/violent men because they do n't trust police/support services new training being offered to sw front-line services by @ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Harriet Bradshaw
BBC South West

documents.title: train fare cheat assaulted inspector and ate her notes
text: a man who tried to buy a child 's fare on a train through cornwall assaulted a ticket inspector and ate her notes when she attempted to fine him .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: cornwall travel : bridge 'struck ' in tideford
text: on the a38 in tideford , there are reports of slow traffic due to a bridge being struck by a vehicle between the b3249 and the a374 near the trerulefoot roundabout .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: urgent call to repair barnstaple 's drains and pavements
text: there 's a call for urgent action to repair barnstaple 's blocked drains and broken pavements .
the mayor and members of the town council said they had received many complaints from worried locals who reported that some paving stones were getting too dangerous for disabled people to negotiate .
it was also claimed that many roadside drain covers were so blocked with mud and debris that they were unable to operate properly .
the town council said devon county council had been asked to start repair work as a matter of urgency .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: mps demand armed forces assurances from government
text: south west mps are demanding assurances from the government over its long-term ambitions for the armed forces in plymouth .
it 's after former defence chiefs warned that the royal navy could lose its ability to attack enemy held beaches if planned defence cuts go ahead .
two plymouth-based specialist landing ships , hms albion and hms bulwark ( could be taken out of service under the proposals , according to reports .

the labour mp for plymouth sutton and devonport , luke pollard , challenged ministers during a special debate on the uk 's amphibious capability - the ability to operate on land and water - saying the city must be the centre of such operations `` in name and strength '' .

conservative mp for plymouth moor view johnny mercer added that such cuts would make the uk vulnerable , and south east cornwall conservative mp sheryll murray said the devonport naval base was a vital local employer .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: elsie scully-hicks : adoptive dad was 'jekyll and hyde '
text: a part-time fitness instructor from cornwall who murdered his adopted baby daughter was a `` jekyll and hyde '' character who managed to convince his husband and the authorities that he was a `` model citizen and parent '' , a family court judge has said .

matthew scully-hicks passed the rigorous adoption process with `` flying colours '' and seemed `` eminently suitable '' , before being allowed to adopt two young children , according to mr justice moor .

but despite presenting as a `` man of the utmost respectability and good character who showed kindness , love , patience and care to anyone in whom he came into contact , including children '' the 31-year-old , from delabole , was `` quite unable to control himself '' when it came to looking after his youngest child , elsie .
mr justice moor published a fact-finding judgment , completed in relation to care proceedings for elsie 's adopted sibling - known only as c - on monday .

scully-hicks , who gave up work to care for the couple 's children , denied harming elsie but was sentenced to life in prison with a minimum term of 18 years after being convicted of murder at cardiff crown court .

cardiff and vale of glamorgan regional safeguarding children board is now carrying out an independent child practice review to examine the `` tragic circumstances '' of elsie 's death , a spokesman said .
author: Press Association

documents.title: tonia couch retires from competition : tom daley 's tribute
text: plymouth-based three-time olympian tonia couch has announced her retirement from diving .
the 28-year-old is one of britain 's most decorated female divers having won silver in glasgow 2014 commonwealth and three european medals during a 12-year senior career .

fellow plymouth-born diver daley has spent his entire career on the gb team with couch and in february the pair finally competed together in the 10m mixed synchronised diving event at the national cup .
he told bbc sport : `` tonia has been my best friend in diving for as long as i can remember and i 'm going to miss my best friend coming on trips with me .
`` she is the most successful british female diver i have ever known and she will leave a lasting legacy in the diving world . ''
tonia is due to take up a coaching role in her home city .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cornwall travel : accident on a39 halloon roundabout
text: on the a39 , on parka road on the halloon roundabout , there is heavy traffic and it is partially blocked due to an accident on the roundabout .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: labour leader corbyn attends candy atherton 's funeral
text: labour party leader jeremy corbyn is attending the funeral of former cornwall mp candy atherton in the county .
the councillor and former mp died suddenly on 30 october , aged 62 .
she won the marginal seat of falmouth and camborne in 1997 for labour , holding it for eight years , before losing it in 2005 to the liberal democrats .
she was elected to cornwall council in 2013 .
ms atherton also previously served as mayor of islington , in mr corbyn 's parliamentary constituency .
mr corbyn previously said that he was `` sad '' to hear of her sudden death and remembered `` her time as mayor of islington with great affection '' .
he also called her a `` proud champion of cornwall '' .
he and shadow chancellor john mcdonnell also famously came to her rescue after her wheelchair got stuck on stage at the labour party conference in 2015 ( below ) .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: met office issues yellow warning for wind
text: a yellow severe weather warning for # wind has been issued for wednesday and thursday : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid
there is a risk of gales across the whole of england and wales through tomorrow and into thursday # weatheraware
will there also be a warning for the high wind speeds predicted for sat 25th ?
hi andrew - we 'll continue to monitor the situation .
you can learn more about how we issue warnings here : ^rachael
stops exactly at the scottish border ?
how polite !
doesnt seem as bad as the last one `` brian '' looking at wind speed monitoring sites for the week ahead , certainly not the gusts that `` brian '' had .
i 'm not the only one raising an eyebrow at the zone stopping at the england-scotland border and avoiding the isle of mann .
hope people stay up to date on this warning .
batten down the hatches
author: Twitter

documents.title: brexit : customs checks at ports 'could take place inland '
text: new customs checkpoints may need to be built `` inland '' at british ports to handle the increased workload after brexit , a senior official has said .

karen wheeler , director general of borders at revenue and customs , said new infrastructure would be needed to `` facilitate '' customs controls and it would be up to ports to decide where to locate them .
but space was tight at some ports , so they might have to be inland , she added .
labour 's meg hillier said this would be alarming news for cash-strapped councils in port towns .

ms hillier , the mp who chairs the public accounts committee , said local councils in places like plymouth , holyhead or dover , were facing real financial challenges and would be potentially be alarmed at this `` new revelation '' .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: weather : mostly dry and cloudy but drizzle possible
text: staying mostly dry and cloudy today , but with the occasional brighter period possible .
over moors and perhaps other areas of high ground , a few spots of drizzle are likely .
it will be mild with moderate or fresh southwesterly winds becoming strong around the coast .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
tonight , it will be remaining mostly dry and cloudy , but with some light drizzle over high ground .
however , during the evening , a short period of heavier rain is possible towards the north coast .
there may also be the odd clearer period during the night .
but it will continue breezy with fresh to strong southwesterly winds reaching near gale force around the coast towards morning .
minimum temperature : 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: cornwall council pays tribute to candy atherton
text: members of cornwall council have paid tribute to the late candy atherton at today 's full council meeting at county hall in truro before her funeral .
the councillor and former mp died suddenly on 30 october , aged 62 .
she won the marginal seat of falmouth and camborne in 1997 for labour , holding it for eight years , doubling her majority in 2001 , but losing her seat in 2005 to the liberal democrats .
after her parliamentary career , she focused on rural housing and women 's issues .
she served as a cornwall councillor after being elected in 2013 .
the council 's meeting is adjourning for her funeral , which is due to start at noon .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: great photo oppor-tuna-ty as bluefin fish spotted off fowey
text: a kayaker who comes into close contact with marine life has had a lucky find recently in cornwall .
the blue planet team travelled thousands of miles in search of a tuna feeding frenzy seen in sunday night 's episode .
however , rupert kirkwood was paddling at sea just two miles off fowey and managed to take some incredible photos of a bluefin tuna which was breaking the surface of the water .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon travel : accident on a388 stibb cross
text: at stibb cross , there are reports of an accident on the a388 around b3227 .
it 's affecting traffic between holsworthy and great torrington .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: alternatives to bbc licence fee model 'do n't stack up '
text: a devon tory mp has reeled off a list of things `` netflix does n't give you '' as he defended the bbc from comparisons with the internet television giant .
peter heaton-jones , a former bbc journalist and presenter , made the comments as he recalled a conversation with a constituent over the two services .
`` he said 'netflix costs me half as much as the bbc , and has five times the content ' , '' said north devon mp mr heaton-jones .

`` here 's what netflix does n't have : it does n't have radio , does n't have regional broadcasting , does n't have news and current affairs , it does n't have the huge educational programmes , it does n't put computers into schools , it does n't cover live sport , it does n't have the huge community events that bring the country together like children in need raising £ 50m last friday .
that 's what netflix does n't give you . ''

mr heaton-jones said alternatives to the current licence fee funding model for the bbc `` do n't stack up '' , adding : `` when it comes to subscription or advertising , they would be extraordinarily retrograde steps .

`` if you allow the bbc to take advertising , not only do you immediately raise questions about impartiality and neutrality , but frankly also come midnight most nights you would have a live roulette wheel , which is exactly what you have on itv most nights . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: plymouth 'should concentrate on getting rail link upgrade '
text: plymouth city council has called for the m5 to be extended another 40 miles to reach plymouth .
it currently finishes at exeter , with the a38 then providing a dual carriageway route on to plymouth .

the council said a lack of connectivity by road prevented the plymouth area playing its part in improving productivity and economic growth and that , at the moment , the city `` can not fulfil our potential '' .

@ johnnymerceruk says tory colleagues on @ twitterid should concentrate on campaign to upgrade sw rail links `` rather than talking about things which , frankly , i do n't think are ever going to happen '' - ie extension of m5 to plymouth
look at that tash @ twitterid
in response to what he 's talking about why ca n't our mp 's campaign for both ?
mercer shifting the blame .
what was it he said about getting the railway sorted during his campaign ?
did n't he slate luke pollard for campaigning about our railways ?
probably .
it 's 2017 and there 's still only one rail link into the south west which gets cut off every winter .
not hard to realise there needs to be an alternative
words can not describe how little this man has done for plymouth .
he is a self-servative and only in politics for himself not the city , @ twitterid has done more for this city in his 6 months than mercer has done in his several years .
as a regular traveller to heathrow something has to be done .
stop the petty bickering , work together & get some funding , when was the last time we witnessed any travel infrastructure improvements to plymouth ?
not in my lifetime & i 'm 54 , make a difference or shut up please
sorry but not aware of anything that @ twitterid has done for rail services sw rail task force was pushed by @ twitterid @ twitterid
perhaps mr mercer could spend more time listening to the people of plymouth rather than blocking them on social media if they challenge him .
my crime- asking him to collaborate with other local mps on defence cuts rather than mocking them @ twitterid
campaign for both ?
sw loosing out every way @ twitterid no dedicated railway station & poor road/rail links .
@ twitterid still shut .
@ twitterid no rail station poor connectivity .
@ twitterid route to plymouth cash tavistock homes pay part not open !
no hst speed track to cornwall !
has he grown a 'tache ?
looks hilarious .
is it supposed to make him look less like a young kid out of his depth ?
well they certainly wo n't happen under the deceitful tories
no different from all of cornwall 's mps , self first , the party second and constituents trailing in last .
what have they done for cornwall apart from opening a few fetes .
time for changes .
up grade of the rail is n't either
would m5 extension be easier and cheaper than rail upgrade ?
also , why should n't our mps be engaged in all issues that might improve their constituency ?
spot on !
how would extending the m5 help at all ?
author: Martyn Oates
BBC South West Political Editor

documents.title: man assaulted and taken to cash machine by robbers
text: police have appealed for witnesses after a 31-year-old man was assaulted by two other men before being taken to a cash machine to withdraw money in plymouth .
officers said the victim was attacked and robbed on wednesday 15 november following an altercation with at least two men outside the switch bar on north hill at about 05:30 .

three men were then seen walking together through the north cross underpass at about 05:50 , and along the subway towards the railway station , before the victim was seen using a cash machine at the front of the railway station with another man stood close at his shoulder at about 06:00 .
police said they were keen to trace a woman who was walking in the underpass at the time and stopped to turn around and look at the group .

documents.title: tonia couch retires from competition : her achievements
text: plymouth-based three-time olympian tonia couch has announced her retirement from diving .
the 28-year-old is one of britain 's most decorated female divers having won glasgow 2014 commonwealth silver and three european medals during a 12-year senior career .

she made her major international debut at the 2005 world championships in montreal when she was just 16 , before going on to finish fourth at the commonwealth games in melbourne , australia , 12 months later .

she said she saw reaching the beijing 2008 individual 10m platform final in her olympic debut as one of her career highlights , while she also finished fifth in the synchronised events at london 2012 and rio 2016 .
diving - fully-clothed - into the london olympic pool with the entire gb team to celebrate tom daley 's dramatic bronze was another stand-out moment for her .
`` even though it was someone else winning the medal , it felt like we all won it , '' said the 2012 european champion .
she is due to take up a coaching role in her home city .
author: Nick Hope
BBC Sport

documents.title: stolen car hauled from quarry
text: a car has been hauled from a dartmoor quarry after it was reportedly stolen from a tavistock dealer .
divers from devon and cornwall police said it was winched out of the water on monday once they had made the discovery .
drb car sales told the bbc it was one of four cars stolen during a break in on 6 october amounting to a value of about £ 20,000 .
the other vehicles were found `` burnt out on moors and in another quarry , '' a spokesman said .
police say no arrests have yet been made .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Dan Downs
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: funeral for cornwall ex-labour mp candy atherton
text: a funeral service is due to be held later for candy atherton , the cornwall councillor and former mp .
the 62-year-old died suddenly on 30 october .
she won the marginal seat of falmouth and camborne in 1997 for labour , holding it for eight years , doubling her majority in 2001 , but losing her seat in 2005 to the liberal democrats .
after her parliamentary career , she focused on rural housing and women 's issues .
she served as a cornwall councillor after being elected in 2013 .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: council tax is set to go up in plymouth
text: plymouth families are to be hit with another rise in their council tax bills , the herald can reveal .
the council has agreed upon a fresh financial strategy which says families will likely have to cough up extra for another year running .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: weather : dry and mild , but also cloudy
text: a largely dry , mild but cloudy day is expected .
whilst some brighter spells are possible throughout , these will remain infrequent .
it will also be rather breezy .
cloud could also thicken across higher ground , bringing the odd spot of drizzle .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: motorcyclist seriously injured in three-vehicle crash
text: a motorcyclist has been seriously injured in a three-vehicle crash near camborne , police say .
officers said a 125cc honda bike was being ridden from the direction of connor downs , towards camborne , on the old a30 roseworthy hill , when the crash happened at about 16:45 on monday .
the bike initially clipped a kia sportage coming in the opposite direction before `` substantially colliding '' with a peugeot bipper van also travelling in the opposite direction , police said .
the 21-year-old rider , who is local , was taken to derriford hospital in plymouth with `` significant injuries which are believed to be life-changing but not life-threatening '' .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: milking it ? priest makes dog collar from dairy bottle
text: a quick-thinking parish priest has used a plastic milk bottle to make himself an emergency dog collar .
the reverend caspar bush , rector of redruth in cornwall , was in need of a new one after his last one snapped on friday 17 november .
he used a four-pint milk bottle to fashion the garment , explaining `` no other bottle seemed to have a big enough flat bit that was completely white '' .
he wore the new collar to carry out church duties at the weekend .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel : a39 at bideford is partially blocked
text: the a39 at bideford is partially blocked by a collision between a car and a motorbike around buckleigh road .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: plymouth olympian tonia couch retires from diving
text: three-time olympian tonia couch has ruled out a medal bid at next year 's commonwealth games and announced her retirement from diving .
couch , 28 , is one of britain 's most decorated female divers having won glasgow 2014 commonwealth silver and three european medals during a 12-year senior career .
she last competed at the world championships in july , but will now take up a coaching role in her home city of plymouth .
`` i 've achieved more than i ever could have imagined , '' she told bbc sport .
author: Nick Hope
BBC Sport

documents.title: police commissioner to face another no confidence motion
text: devon and cornwall police and crime commissioner alison hernandez is due to face another no confidence motion by a south west council later .
following similar votes at plymouth city council and devon county council , today 's motion before cornwall council has been tabled by a labour councillor with liberal democrat support .
it highlights concerns over cuts to the number of pcsos and previous comments about armed civilians and terrorists .
conservative ms hernandez said it was `` political mischief making '' , and that she had made £ 24m available to increase police officer numbers .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: elsie scully-hicks : killer dad 'was suitable to adopt '
text: a father who murdered his 18-month-old baby was given a `` glowing report '' on his suitability to adopt her , a judge has found .
elsie scully-hicks died in cardiff in may 2016 from catastrophic injuries inflicted by matthew scully-hicks , 31 , of delabole , cornwall .
a family court inquiry carried out before his trial found he appeared to be `` eminently suitable to adopt '' .
he was jailed for life and must serve at least 18 years in prison .
author: BBC Wales News

documents.title: axminster commercial property damaged in fire
text: a commercial property in axminster has been damaged in a fire .
three fire crews were called to the scene in silver street at about 00:55 after a fire alarm went off .
firefighters extinguished a small fire in a rear room on the ground floor .
there was some heat damage to the affected area and light smoke damage to the first and second floor of the building , devon and somerset fire and rescue service said .
the cause is being investigated .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cornwall travel : problems in brighton and chiverton cross
text: cornwall travel : problems in brighton and chiverton cross
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: sex workers 'do n't report abuse because of lack of trust '
text: there are concerns sex workers in devon and cornwall are failing to report abusive and violent predators who pose a risk to the wider public because they do n't trust the police and support services .
verbal abuse , stalking and violent sexual assault are just some of the incidents reported by sex workers here to the charity national ugly mugs .
but it said the reports were a fraction of the actual crimes committed because victims did not trust the authorities .
now front line services such as the police are being trained to support sex workers more effectively .
insp dave meredith , from devon and cornwall police , said the force was committed to supporting people who 've been abused - regardless of their profession - and urged victims to come forward .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for tuesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live
